skill.name: defi-protocol-templates
skill.description: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending systems. Use when building decentralized finance applications or smart contract protocols.
skill.summary: Implement DeFi protocols with production-ready templates for staking, AMMs, governance, and lending ...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, network exfiltration, or execution payloads detected. The content is Solidity templates and guidance only.

content.value_statement: You need solid DeFi contract templates but do not want to start from scratch. This skill provides ready structures for common protocols so you can adapt quickly.
actual_capabilities: Provides a staking rewards contract template with reward accounting
Provides a simple AMM contract with liquidity and swap logic
Provides governance token and proposal voting templates
Provides a flash loan provider and receiver example
limitations: No tests or deployment scripts are included
Templates are not audited for production use
No price oracle or liquidation logic is provided
Referenced assets and reference docs are not included in this package

use_cases.title: Prototype a DeFi MVP
use_cases.description: Adapt staking and AMM templates to validate a new protocol idea quickly.

use_cases.title: Plan protocol scope
use_cases.description: Review governance and flash loan examples to define product requirements.

use_cases.title: Compare baseline patterns
use_cases.description: Use the templates as a baseline to spot missing controls in custom code.

prompt_templates.title: Staking basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize the staking rewards template and list the key state variables and events.

prompt_templates.title: AMM setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how addLiquidity and swap work in the AMM template and note any math assumptions.

prompt_templates.title: Governance flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the governance proposal lifecycle in the template and list where custom logic should go.

prompt_templates.title: Flash loan safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify security checks in the flash loan template and suggest two additional safeguards.

output_examples.input: Explain the AMM template and list the main functions.
output: The AMM tracks two token reserves and issues liquidity shares.
Main functions are addLiquidity, removeLiquidity, and swap.
Prices use a constant product model with a 0.3 percent fee.

best_practices: Add comprehensive unit tests before deployment
Use audited libraries for token and access control logic
Review math for overflow and rounding assumptions
anti_patterns: Skipping access control and pause mechanisms
Ignoring token decimal and fee edge cases

faq.question: What platforms are compatible?
faq.answer: The templates are Solidity based and target EVM chains that support OpenZeppelin libraries.

faq.question: What are the limits of the templates?
faq.answer: They are minimal examples and do not include full oracle, liquidation, or upgrade logic.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my project?
faq.answer: Copy the relevant contract template and adapt interfaces, parameters, and access control.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data?
faq.answer: No. It contains static templates and guidance with no data collection code.

faq.question: What if compilation fails?
faq.answer: Check Solidity version, dependencies, and imports for OpenZeppelin compatibility.

faq.question: How does this compare to full protocol frameworks?
faq.answer: It is lighter and faster for prototyping but lacks complete production features.
